result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return date on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Letter from Atty. Mays for setover

1:05 PM Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court.  Attorney Stephen Eric Mays in court for Derek S. Nehls.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Mays acknowledges rec. information in 22CF192 and waives reading and enters NG pleas.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Atty Mays notes he rec'd email from assigned ADA on this case just today - requests both matters track for RD or status.  Bonds continued.
Return date scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE may not make any direct threats or acts of violence towards his wife, J.B. and DE must comply with any limitations on contact established by the family court in 22FA170.

9:57 AM Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court.  Attorney Stephen Eric Mays in court for Derek S. Nehls.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin. State opposes the motion to modify bond that was filed in April.  Atty Mays an offer of proof for the motion.  Court questions the victim regarding living situation.  State states objection.    Atty Mays states argument.  Court questions victim regarding status of divorce.  Court grants the motion and directs that no contact be modified as follows: DE may not make any direct threats or acts of violence towards his wife, J.B. and DE must comply with any limitations on contact established by the family court in 22FA170.
Arraignment scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:57 AM Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court.  Attorney Stephen Eric Mays in court for Derek S. Nehls.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Atty Mays requests arraignment be set out.  Matter reset.
Motion hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact w/J.J.N., except by electronic means re: child;   May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.

02:57 PM Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Mays.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek S. Nehls appeared by video means from SAUK Co..  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests $150 cash bail. Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $2000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/J.J.N., except by electronic means re: child.  May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:45 am.
